intro: Parasopubia hofmannii, commonly known as the Hofmann's parasopubia, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of South America. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its deep root system. Its foliage is often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
